Visualization: Overview

The visualization module provides comprehensive plotting and animation utilities for creating publication-quality figures across all METAINFORMANT domains.

Module Organization

The visualization package is organized into category-specific modules:

Core Plotting Modules

  • Basic Plots: Line, scatter, bar, pie, area, step plots, and heatmaps

  • Statistical Plots: Histograms, box plots, violin plots, Q-Q plots, density plots, ROC curves

  • Genomics Plots: Manhattan plots, volcano plots, regional plots, chromosome ideograms

  • Expression Plots: Expression heatmaps, enrichment plots, differential expression

  • Dimensionality Reduction: PCA, UMAP, t-SNE plots with loadings and scree plots

  • Network Plots: Network graphs, circular layouts, hierarchical layouts

  • Time Series: Time series plots, autocorrelation, seasonal decomposition, forecasts

  • Multi-dimensional: Pair plots, parallel coordinates, radar charts, 3D scatter

  • Quality Control: QC metrics, quality scores, adapter content, sequence length

  • Information Theory: Entropy plots, mutual information, information profiles

Specialized Modules

  • Trees: Phylogenetic tree visualization with multiple layouts

  • Animations: Time series, evolution, clustering, network, and trajectory animations

Utility Modules

  • Styling: Publication-quality styles, color palettes, font management

  • Layout: Multi-panel figure creation and layout management

  • Export: High-resolution export in multiple formats

  • Interactive: Plotly integration for interactive plots

Domain Integration

  • GWAS Integration: Unified access to GWAS visualization functions

  • Single-Cell Integration: Single-cell RNA-seq visualization functions

  • Information Theory Integration: Information theory visualization functions

  • Life Events Integration: Life course event visualization functions

Quick Start

from metainformant.visualization import (
    lineplot, scatter_plot, histogram, heatmap,
    manhattan_plot, volcano_plot, pca_plot,
    plot_phylo_tree, animate_time_series
)

# Basic plots
ax = lineplot(None, [1, 4, 2, 8, 5])
ax = scatter_plot([1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6])
ax = histogram([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], bins=10)

# Genomic plots
ax = manhattan_plot(data, 'position', 'neg_log10_p', 'chromosome')
ax = volcano_plot(data, 'log2fc', 'neg_log10_p')

# Dimensionality reduction
ax = pca_plot(data, pc_x=1, pc_y=2, hue='group')

# Trees
from Bio import Phylo
tree = Phylo.read("tree.nwk", "newick")
ax = plot_phylo_tree(tree)

# Animations
fig, anim = animate_time_series([1, 2, 3, 2, 4, 5])
